quotes: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the ax.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: The best thing about the future is that it comes one day at a time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: You can tell the greatness of a man by what makes him angry.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Have I not destroyed my enemy when I have made him into my friend?
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Force is all conquering, but its victories are short lived.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: My best friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: And this, too, shall pass away.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Don’t worry when you are not recognized, but strive to be worthy of recognition.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Avoid popularity if you would have peace.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Those who deny freedom to others, deserve it not for themselves.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: I don't like that man. I must get to know him better.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: I laugh because I must not cry, that is all, that is all.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: All I have learned, I learned from books.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Every man's happiness is his own responsibility.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: You have to do your own growing no matter how tall your grandfather was.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: The better part of one's life consists of his friendships.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Determine that the thing can and shall be done and then... find the way.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: No man is good enough to govern another man without that other’s consent.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Tis better people think you a fool, then open your mouth and erase all doubt.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: If slavery is not wrong, nothing is wrong.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: If you want to test a man's character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: Don't criticize them; they are just what we would be under similar circumstances.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: I would just as soon die now, but I haven't done anything yet to be remembered by.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: The strength of a nation lies in the homes of its people.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: My great concern is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with your failure.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes: If I am killed, I can die but once; but to live in constant dread of it, is to die over and over again.
author: Abraham Lincoln
